text: Hi there, I've made a Makie plot which allows me to scroll through grid view of a labeled data set intended for machine learning applications. The plot shows different data transformations along the columns, and different data points along the rows, and supports scrolling with up/down arrow keys. The image/gist shows how I can use it to plot the MNIST data set (<https://gist.github.com/jonalm/d88d7e65ea3945d9dcbaf206e546f69d>). I experience that the Makie plot suddenly crashes after some scrolling, but I've tried to make sure that I'm not allocating new memory when scrolling. How can I debug such crashes? Is there a convenient way to log what goes on with the plot Observables during the lifetime of the plot?

elements.text: Hi there, I've made a Makie plot which allows me to scroll through grid view of a labeled data set intended for machine learning applications. The plot shows different data transformations along the columns, and different data points along the rows, and supports scrolling with up/down arrow keys. The image/gist shows how I can use it to plot the MNIST data set (

). I experience that the Makie plot suddenly crashes after some scrolling, but I've tried to make sure that I'm not allocating new memory when scrolling. How can I debug such crashes? Is there a convenient way to log what goes on with the plot Observables during the lifetime of the plot?

text:
This is after LOTS of scrolling:
```julia> print_sizes()
Base.format_bytes(Sys.free_memory()) = "1.900 GiB"
Core.Main: 187.113 MiB
Base.uvhandles: 80.168 MiB
GLMakie.AbstractPlotting: 67.474 MiB
GLFW._window_callbacks: 53.204 MiB
GLMakie.GLOBAL_GL_SCREEN: 53.202 MiB
Core.Compiler: 26.672 MiB
Base._TYPE_NAME: 17.856 MiB
WGLMakie.SAVE_POINTER_IDENTITY_FOR_TEXTURES: 11.724 MiB
Base.Broadcast: 7.393 MiB

julia> print_sizes()
Base.format_bytes(Sys.free_memory()) = "1.897 GiB"
Core.Main: 187.113 MiB
Base.uvhandles: 80.526 MiB
GLMakie.AbstractPlotting: 67.474 MiB
GLFW._window_callbacks: 53.204 MiB
GLMakie.GLOBAL_GL_SCREEN: 53.202 MiB
Core.Compiler: 26.672 MiB
Base._TYPE_NAME: 17.856 MiB
WGLMakie.SAVE_POINTER_IDENTITY_FOR_TEXTURES: 11.724 MiB
Base.Broadcast: 7.393 MiB```

text: Yeah, thanks, it isn’t really for MNIST, but for ultra-wide-band radar signal processing (<https://novelda.com>). It is really convenient to plot our input data with multiple different transformations. I got my mac back from repair today, so I’m glad the plot works smoothly there, but I try to push julia to colleagues on windows machines. Happy to help if I can help diagnose the silent crash issue.

attachments.title: Single-chip radar sensors with sub-mm resolution - Novelda
attachments.text: The Novelda radar sensor is a complete CMOS system integrated on a single chip. Perfect for respiration monitoring, presence detection, and home automation
